Completion Prompts: Name one action you will take to reinforce today's repair.
Identify one signal that shows our relationship is strengthening.
Choose one commitment to focus on this week to support our path forward.

Overall Outcomes.Excellent: You address both surface and root issues, restoring trust and collaboration → The future moves forward stronger and more resilient.
Overall Outcomes.Expected: You address the surface issues but not the underlying dynamics → The future remains functional but prone to repeated breakdowns.
Overall Outcomes.Poor: You ignore or avoid the strain → The future carries unresolved tension, mistrust, and reduced effectiveness.
Overall Outcomes.Transcendent: Relational repair is embedded in team culture → The future consistently turns conflict into growth and deeper connection.

Overall Purpose: To restore trust, understanding, and effective collaboration within a team after conflict, misunderstanding, or harm.

Guiding Questions: What is the strain we need to address?
How can we name it in a way that invites repair?
Themes.Name: Naming the Strain

Excellent.Example moves: Stating the specific dynamic or event that caused tension.
Excellent.Future effect: The future moves forward stronger and more resilient.
Excellent.Present pattern: You clearly name the strain and its impact.
Excellent.Signals: Clear, direct conversations about what happened.

Expected.Example moves: Saying 'We had a bump' without context.
Expected.Future effect: The future remains functional but prone to repeated breakdowns.
Expected.Immediate cost: Some awareness created, but no clear path forward.
Expected.Present pattern: You acknowledge the strain briefly but without depth.

Poor.Future effect: The future carries unresolved tension, mistrust, and reduced effectiveness.
Poor.Signals: Avoidance of certain topics or people.

Transcendent.Example moves: Using regular check-ins to identify tension early.
Transcendent.Future effect: The future consistently turns conflict into growth and deeper connection.
Transcendent.Present pattern: Naming strain is normalized and safe.
Transcendent.Signals: Comfort in naming and addressing tension.

Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To openly acknowledge that tension or harm exists.
Themes.Why This Matters: Naming the strain brings the issue into the open, signaling readiness for repair.

Guiding Questions: What part did I play in this breakdown?
What could I have done differently?
How can I communicate my ownership clearly?
Themes.Name: Owning Our Part

Excellent.Example moves: Naming exactly what you did or didn’t do that contributed.
Excellent.Future effect: The future moves forward stronger and more resilient.
Excellent.Present pattern: You fully own your part in the breakdown.

Expected.Edge condition: Avoiding full ownership to protect image.
Expected.Example moves: Saying 'I could have done better' without specifics.
Expected.Future effect: The future remains functional but prone to repeated breakdowns.
Expected.Present pattern: You acknowledge a role but minimize it.

Poor.Edge condition: Fear of losing face or authority.
Poor.Future effect: The future carries unresolved tension, mistrust, and reduced effectiveness.
Poor.Present pattern: You deny any role in the problem.

Transcendent.Example moves: Structured reflection on each person’s contribution.
Transcendent.Future effect: The future consistently turns conflict into growth and deeper connection.
Transcendent.Present pattern: Ownership is standard in conflict resolution.
Transcendent.Signals: Frequent, unforced acknowledgment of contributions to issues.

Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To acknowledge personal contributions to the breakdown.
Themes.Why This Matters: Taking responsibility builds credibility and models accountability.

Guiding Questions: What is their perspective on this situation?
What do they need me to understand?
How can I reflect it back accurately?
Themes.Name: Understanding Each Other’s Perspective

Excellent.Example moves: Summarizing the other person’s view to confirm accuracy.
Excellent.Future effect: The future moves forward stronger and more resilient.
Excellent.Present pattern: You actively seek and reflect others’ perspectives.
Excellent.Signals: Detailed reflection of what you’ve heard.

Expected.Future effect: The future remains functional but prone to repeated breakdowns.
Expected.Immediate cost: Some understanding, but not enough for full repair.
Expected.Present pattern: You listen but only partially acknowledge.

Poor.Future effect: The future carries unresolved tension, mistrust, and reduced effectiveness.
Poor.Present pattern: You dismiss or ignore others’ perspectives.

Transcendent.Example moves: Embedding perspective-sharing rounds in repair conversations.
Transcendent.Future effect: The future consistently turns conflict into growth and deeper connection.
Transcendent.Signals: High comfort in expressing and receiving perspectives.

Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To listen for and acknowledge the experiences, needs, and feelings of those involved.
Themes.Why This Matters: Understanding builds empathy, reduces defensiveness, and opens paths to resolution.

Guiding Questions: What do we need to agree on to prevent this happening again?
What commitments will we make to each other?
How will we track and revisit these agreements?
Themes.Name: Agreeing on the Path Forward

Excellent.Future effect: The future moves forward stronger and more resilient.
Excellent.Present pattern: You co-create clear agreements for the future.

Expected.Edge condition: Keeping commitments broad to avoid discomfort.
Expected.Example moves: Agreeing to 'communicate better' without defining how.
Expected.Future effect: The future remains functional but prone to repeated breakdowns.

Poor.Edge condition: Avoiding agreements to keep things light.
Poor.Example moves: Ending with 'Let’s just move on' without specifics.
Poor.Future effect: The future carries unresolved tension, mistrust, and reduced effectiveness.
Poor.Present pattern: You end the conversation without a clear path forward.
Poor.Signals: No commitments or follow-up after repair talk.

Transcendent.Edge condition: Avoiding rigidity that ignores evolving needs.
Transcendent.Example moves: Using written agreements as part of repair culture.
Transcendent.Future effect: The future consistently turns conflict into growth and deeper connection.

Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To define together how you will prevent recurrence and strengthen the relationship.
Themes.Why This Matters: A shared plan ensures repair is actionable and sustainable.

Guiding Questions: How will we follow up to ensure the repair holds?
When will we check in next?
What signs will tell us the relationship is stronger?
Themes.Name: Reinforcing the Repair

Excellent.Edge condition: Balancing check-ins with respect for autonomy.
Excellent.Example moves: Scheduling a follow-up meeting to review agreements.
Excellent.Future effect: The future moves forward stronger and more resilient.
Excellent.Present pattern: You intentionally follow up to reinforce repair.

Expected.Edge condition: Following up only if issues reappear.
Expected.Example moves: Casual chats about 'how things are going'.
Expected.Future effect: The future remains functional but prone to repeated breakdowns.
Expected.Present pattern: You check in informally without a plan.
Expected.Signals: Mixed signals about the health of the relationship.

Poor.Example moves: Not revisiting the topic after initial talk.
Poor.Future effect: The future carries unresolved tension, mistrust, and reduced effectiveness.
Poor.Present pattern: You never check back in after the repair conversation.

Transcendent.Example moves: Embedding follow-up rounds into repair processes.
Transcendent.Future effect: The future consistently turns conflict into growth and deeper connection.
Transcendent.Signals: Conflicts rarely recur without new contributing factors.

Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To intentionally follow up and ensure the repair holds over time.
Themes.Why This Matters: Follow-up solidifies trust and makes repair lasting.

Title: Team Protocol – Relational Repair
When To Use This Protocol: Use when tension, conflict, or a breakdown in trust has occurred within a team, and you want to restore alignment, connection, and collaborative capacity.
Why This Matters: Unrepaired relational fractures in a team erode trust, reduce performance, and create ongoing tension. Repairing relationships proactively strengthens the foundation for future work.
